events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred on March 28th involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was categorized under 'Auto Accident' following the initial review of the incident details and reported damage.
An agent specializing in auto accident claims was assigned to handle the investigation and communication with the claimant.
The insurer formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and notified the policyholder of the next steps in the process.
The claimant was asked to submit the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and contact information for witnesses.
The customer provided all requested documents including the police report, photographic evidence, and repair estimates.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and contacted involved parties to validate the accident details.
Investigation concluded confirming the insured was not at fault, and damage assessments were consistent with reported collision.
A settlement amount covering all repair costs and related expenses was proposed to the claimant for review and approval.
The policyholder expressed satisfaction with the transparency and efficiency throughout the claim handling process.
Following customer confirmation, the claim was approved and authorized for payment issuance to the repair vendor.
The payment for approved vehicle repairs was transferred directly to the authorized repair shop as per the claim settlement.
The claim file was officially closed after confirming payment completion and customer satisfaction with resolution.
All claim related documents and communications were securely archived in the insurance system for future reference.
